div.l: Alle was owte of his mynde his husbondrye
What whilke weye is he go he gan̄ crye
The wif cam lepyng Inward at a renne
She seid allas youre hors gothe to the Fenne
With wilde mares / as fast as he may goo
Vnthanke come to his hande / þᵗat bonde hym soo
And he that better / sholde have knyt the reyne
Allas qduod Iohn Aleyn / for crystes peyne
Leye down̄ thy swerd and I will myn alswa
I is full swyfte god wot as any ra
By goddes herte / he shall nat scape vs baothebothebathe
Why ne had þᵘou /putte the caple / in the lathe
Il haile be god Aleyn̄ / þᵘou is a fonne
This sely clerkes / han full fast I ronne
Toward the Fen̄ / bothe Aleyn̄ and eke Iohn
And whan̄ the myller sauh þᵗat they were goon̄
Half a busshell of hir floure / he hath take
And bad his wyf go g g knede it in a cake
And seid I trowe the clerkes weren a ferde
Yit can a myller / make a clerkes beerd
For alle hir arte yit lete hem go hir weie
Lo where he gothe / ye lete the children pleie
Theye geten hym not so lightly be my crown̄
This sely myller clerkes myllerclerkes // renneth vp and down̄
With kepe kepe stand stand iossa wardere
Ga whistil thou / and I shall kepe hym here
But shortly tille it was verrey night
They coude not gete hȳm though they diden all here myght
Hir caple catche / it ranne aweye so faste
Tille in a Diche / they caught hȳm at þᵉ laste
